ngoList.actName: Registration of societies WEST BENGAL XXVI 1961
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Odissi Vision and Movement Centre was founded in 1995 with the purpose of promoting Odissi classical dance through research and performances. The institution has a Training Unit, a Performing Unit and a Creative Unit, making the institution interlinked, self sufficient and integrated. Most of the OVM Productions highlight the different aspects of Oriya culture. Sampoorna, OVMâ€™s first full length production has been inspired by the lives of the Temple Dancers of Orissa. Murchhana is based on the Mrudanga Traditions and Dhulikhel is an attempt to expand the boundaries of Odissi by imbibing elements from the folk art forms of West Orissa. Sutra interlinks the folk and Classical forms of Orissa. These are some of the noteworthy productions, which have helped establish OVM Repertory as one of the leading dance companies of India and has toured extensively in India and abroad. Sharmila Biswas, the Founder-Director, is a disciple of Guru Kelucharan Mahapatra. Known for her originality in composition, technique and stage design, her versatility ranges from classical Odissi Dance to experimental choreographic work often based on the traditional movement skills of Orissa. This gives her the strength to reach out for new forms and create new mediums of expressing unique contemporary statements through her work. She has been awarded the Uday Shankar Award, for the best choreography in 1998, by the Dept. Of Information & Broadcasting, Govt. of West Bengal. She has also received the Junior and subsequently the Senior Fellowship Award from the Dept. of Culture, Govt. of India and the Central Sangeet Natak Akademi. Sharmila is graded as a â€˜Topâ€™ artist by Doordarshan (Indian National Television) and â€˜Outstandingâ€™ by â€˜Indian Council of Cultural Relationsâ€™, Ministry of External Affairs, Govt. Of India.

ngoList.title: Onnwesak
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Onnwesak-Dramatic and Cultural Association is a leading Theatre group is dedicated since 1966, to the task of promoting modern and progressive theatre movement in persuance of the best tradition of our cultural heritage.It is theatre and only theatre which inspired us to act as a team with a view to promote healthy culture among the mass. Since 43 years our endless enduavour has created a possitive impact spreaded over the locality 24 Parganas South, the State of West Bengal and in India. 43 years have crowned Onnwesak-with multi-coloured feathers. Important events in the 43 years of Onnwesak : 1) We have produced total No. of Productions-58 (Full length-20 & short play-38). 2) We have organised many full length and short drama theatre festivals featuring our own productions as well as significant productions of other groups. 3. Onnwesak has successfully arranged a good many remarkable seminers and theatre works on theatre with the help of eminent theatre personalities. 4) Onnwesak has given significant emphasis in joint production and collaboration with other groups. Arranged many cultural programme on Recitation, Songs, Mime etc. for the development of local mass and theatre workers. 5) We participated in various Drama Festival and Drama Competition within all over W.B. and other parts of India. Where we have received many awards such as : W.B. Dance-Drama-Music and Fine Arts Best Production in the year 1974 and 1976. 3 times Abhinoy Puraskar, Best Production Award from Lucknow Bengali Club and more than Awards for Best Production, Direction and for Best Actor etc. 6) We have produced 3 full length Drama for Kolkata Doordarsan (Darpan Saskhi, Hesaber Kari and Matir Tane) Written by Chandan Sen. 7) Felicitatation of renowned theatre and cultural personalities. 8) 40 years celebration was organised within a Tri-phased programme. The programme included in grateful reminisence to our colleagues awarding Momento and Certificates, to pay our regards to dedicated Drama personalities, to arrange a Drama Workshop with high profile theatre Memtors and the presentation of Drama Festival by eminent theatre groups including Onnwesak which was arranged at Kolkata and locality. 9) Onnwesak in the process, ventured to produce some significant plays both orginal as well as translated or adopted from important works of grate masters like : Luigi Pirandell, Za Paul Santre, Sewataslab Minakav, Bijon Bhattarcharjee, Tulshi Lihiri, Chandan Sen etc. 10) With the collaboration of local group, we the Onnwesak have produced and organised : Utpal Dutta Drama Festival, Ganga Jamuna Drama Festival, Inter School Drama Festival, Theatre Workshop, Full Length and Short play Drama Festival. In this connection, last but not the least, we have taken various Projects to promote healthy culture among the mass, we think it is probably the high time to think over the depreciation of human values spreaded over the generation and we still continues to perform in and around the kolkata in entire district of South 24 Parganas.

members.name: SWAPAN KUMAR MITRA MAZUMDAR KUMAR MITRA MAZUMDAR

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: PADATIK HAS BEN ACTIVE IN THE FIELD OF THEATRE.AS A THEATRE GROUP IT PRESENTS NEARLY 80 SHOWS EVERY YEAR IN DIFFERENT PARTS OF INDIA.ITS FOUNDER DIRECTOR LT.SRI SHYAMANAND JALAN,A WELL KNOWN THEATRE PERSONALITY WAS A SANGEET NATAK AKADEMY AWARDEE.SHAKESPEARS KING LEAR,BIJAY TENDULKARS SHAKHARAM BINDER AND KANYADAN,MOLIERS SCHOOL OF WIVES AND MOHAN RAKESHS ADHE ADHURE ARE AMONST ITS SUCCESSFULL PRODUCTIONS.PADATIKS TWO PRODUCTIONS BARISHWALA AND SAKHARAM BINDER RECEIVED MUCH CRITICAL ACCLAIM.DIRECTED BY THE NOTED AMERICAN DIRECTOR RODNEY MARIOT,BARISHWALA RECEIVED THE BEST PRODUCTION AWARD FOR 1990 FROM THE WEST BENGAL GOVERNMENT.SAKHARAM BINDER, A REVIVAL DIRECTED BY SHYAMANAND JALAN WITH KHULBUSAN KHARBANDA IN THE LEAD HAS HAD A VERY SUCCESSFUL RUN IN KOLKATA,MUMBAI, PUNE , DELHI AND LUCKNOW.PADATIK HAS THREE OTHER DIRECTORS WORKING WITH IT NAMELY VINAY SHARMA, KUNAL PADHI & PRADIP ROY.PADATIK ORGANISED INTERNATIONAL FESTIVAL & SEMINAR ON THEATRE DANCE AND MARSHALL ARTS IN 1987 AND LOKOTSAV IN 1986.IT ALSO ORGANISED INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON INDIAN DANCE TRADITIONS AND MODERN THEATRE IN COLLABORATION WITH INTERNATIONAL THEATRE INSTITUTE(UNESCO) IN 1983.PADATIK RECEIVES REGULAR SALARY GRANT FROM THE DEPARTMENT OF CULTURE, GOVT OF INDIA.BESIDES IT REGULARLY PARTICIPATES IN VARIOUS FESTIVALS IN INDIA.IT HOLDS SUMMER WORKSHOP, ACTING TRAINING CLASSES AND REGULAR SHOWS AND PRODUCTIONS.

ngoList.title: Padatik Cultural Centre
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Padatik Cultural Centre has presented and has been involved in various unique activities to upgrade and promote dance theatre. It also presented different programmes of other dance forms at our own Padatik Cultural Centre Auditorium and elsewhere. It presented its programmes at various venues in Kolkata and other cities too. April 2013 to June 2013 â€¢ We have carried forward our production â€œMukta Monâ€ from last year. It bears a vital message of Tagore, the man, rarest of rare who has sought freedom of the human heart so passionately that his free spirit as a liberated human mind ever enriched our heart. This year â€œMukta Monâ€ was staged on 5th May 2013 at our auditorium. â€¢ On 30th June 2013, we had staged our new production â€œSome Dotsâ€. â€¢ On 2013 â€œKhudito Pashanâ€ had staged in Satayajit Ray auditorium Kolkata. It is the form of a truly lavish musical which has been performed all over India as part of prominent festivals, cooperative events, etc. This enigmatic story was first brought to the silver screen as a Bengali movie and then as â€œLekinâ€ by Gulzar, starring Vinod Khanna & Dimple Kapadia. October 2013 to December 2013 On 14th December 2013, Padatik Cultural Centre presented two dance pieces â€œFlight of Birdsâ€ and â€œScarlett of Loveâ€ organised by West Bengal State Music Academy at Uday Shankar Dance Festival at Rabindra Sadan Auditorium, Kolkata. â€¢ â€œFlight of Birdsâ€, a musical piece of 20 minutes duration is a story of a family of birds; father, mother and their four children. Changes of their lives are depicted with the changing of seasons like spring, summer, autumn and winter. It is choreographed by Dietmar Seyffert of Germany and its music is given by Pt. Vijai Shankar. The innovative choreography has been recently revived and it features different dance movements of Kathak, Chhau and Ballet. â€¢ Our new production, â€œScarlett of Loveâ€ whose music was given by Mr. Mayukh Bhowmick explores the mystery of love. Mr. Mayukh Bhowmick is a renowned composer for experimental films as well as music compositions. He has been commissioned to work on a music piece which is appealing to our present day audience yet keeping our tradition alive. The Repertory dancers worked hard for this fusion piece taking out each note in the music with subtle movements. January 2014 to March 2014 Two new most important productions of PCC this year include â€œAngvinyasamâ€ and â€œItyalamâ€ presented on 29thJanuary 2014 at Kamani Auditorium, New Delhi. It was presented by our North-east students. All our north-east dancers are excellently trained in Ballet and Classical Jazz Techniques. They have also been trained in Kathak by Chetna Jalan since the last 4 years.

ngoList.title: PADATIK DANCE CENTRE
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: We are seriously involved in imparting training in Kathak and encouraging creativity under the supervision of its Director, Smt Chetna Jalan who is a renowned Kathak exponent. The teaching facility of Padatik Dance Centre is affiliated to Nalanda Dance Research Centre (Mumbai) which runs a diploma course at the centre. The legendary Kathak maestro Pt. Birju Maharaj has been associated with Padatik Dance Centre from 1998 and since then he has been grooming our students by conducting workshops. The centre has its own music recording studio. Some of its best productions can be mentioned as milestones of Padatik Dance Centre . Ramkatha Ramkahani, Ardhashati,Kshudito Pashan,Shrishti, apart from many other productions like Ullas, Vishad,Mand,Swa Chhand,Aboni Bari Aachho,Sufi Experience Padatik Dance Centre is supported by a regular grant for salary from the Department of Culture, Government of India. It also receives grants from the Sangeet Natak Akademi, New Delhi. Padatik Dance Centre has been invited to many major festivals like the Imphal Mahotsav by Sangeet Natak Akademi, New Delhi, Kathak Mahotsav by Kathak Kendra, New Delhi, Khajuraho Festival, Taj Festival. Padatik Dance Centre has also given shows abroad. Through ICCR, Padatik Dance Centre director Chetna Jalan along with her Kathak troupe was invited to perform a full length show at the prestigious Kuopio Dance Festival in Finland held in 1989 at Kuopio. They performed in Kuopio, Lappenranta and Helsinki. Later the troupe performed at Oslo (Norway). Finally Chetna Jalan gave a solo performance in Birmingham (UK) and West Berlin. Later, Padatik Dance Centre troupe was also invited to perform at Seol, Korea, Hongkong and Bangkok. Padatik Dance Centre can boast that in 1984 it organized Kathak Mahotsav to explore the Contemporary Kathak scenario at the national level. Padatik Dance Centre has been approved as the Accredited Centre of Kathak Kendra, New Delhi from Mayâ€™09 at Kolkata and Gurgaon.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Our activities are concerning the promotion of theatrical arts through practice,i.e. to develop the skill of writing plays, designing prodution, acting, sound designing, e.t.c More over we are intended to develop a language of our theatre based on our national traditional performing art forms, which are facing a severe invasion of so called globalized culture now days to eradicate our national cultural identity. In that direction we involved our members to study and research on our local and national performing art forms. Side by side we are trying to utilise ingradients from those art forms in our stage plays and productions successfully, which could able to draw keen attention of theatre goers and scholars that marked our very special existance in the field of theatre in this part of iur country. All these activities are being conducted by our Chief Artistic Director Sri Asit Basu, one of the most revered name in our theatre movements. To achieve our goal we made our effort to render training to children, the future citizens, the art of the theatrical art under the guidance of Ms. Bhadra Basu, an important name and expert in the concerned field. As music is an special acumen of theatre, specially in our traditional theatre forms, we arranged rigorous training in vocal and instrumental music for our members, under the guidance of Ms. Anandee Basu Guha, our meber and a noted singer-actor of our state. Furthermore, we set our members in a continuous process of speech and voice training and as well as in yoga and physical training methods, needed for performing theatre.Our aforesaid activities enabled us to come out as very imortant theatre group within only three years of time. In this three years we have produced two important stage plays SHIBER GAJON and JAAN- E- KALKATTA, which became already talk of the town,and running in packed house, after ten performances. Our work drew attention of theatre lovers to stretch their hands to help us in many ways. Rigtht now we are rehearsing a new play on the impact of Sri Ramakrishna-Philosophy on human society in contemporary time. This is an ambitious magnum project that won the hearts of a full-house audience in its first reading session only. Beside all mentioned above a considerable number of established musicians came closer to us to extend the fraternity bondage among Thespians and Musicians. Visual part of our productions not only appriciated by but brought closer to us many a painter and sculptors. We also produced the popular strret-Play PRATIRODH having 37 shows in two months.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: PRATIKRITI, a leading theatre group in Bengali Theatre, was founded in 1972 under the tutelage of internationally acclaimed actor Soumitra Chatterjee. In 1976, Alok Deb became the director of Pratikriti and since then under his direction the group has produced 17 plays catering to national taste and tradition. Presently, Pratikriti has the following plays for regular performance round the year, viz., Kenaram Becharam, Birsa Mundar Gaan, Darpane Sharatshashi, Dampati, Padmanadeer Majhi and Moinar Maa. In 2000 Pratikriti began its street - theatre wing. Birsa Mundar Gaan, May Dibase Maa, Aloy Phera (against Aids) are among the important plays for regular performance. In 2004, Pratikriti began its another wing, viz,. theatre for the children. So far, Rammohaner Chhelebela, Modhusudaner Chhelebela, Iswarchandra & Shaheed Khudidram have been produced with great success. Presently, early life of Tagore is in the making. Awards won â€“ a) Best production in 1996 awarded by the Drama Academy, Kolkata, b) Best actress awarded by the Govt. West Bengal in 1996. c) Best director (P.B.Award) in 2001. Important Festivals attended â€“ a) 12th Peoplesâ€™ Theatre Festival in Chennai in 12997, b) A 2-day theatre-festival in Delhi in 2002 sponsored by the Impresasrio India, New Delhi, c) Theatre festival in Dhaka, Bangladesh in 2005 sponsored by the theatre group Padatik Dhaka. Important festival of plays organized during the last seven years â€“ a) Foundation day celebration in 2002 & 2003. Besides, important local theatre groups, renowned threatre groups from Dhaka Bangladesh, viz. Theatre Dhaka and Natyajan Dhak, took part in the said festivals, b) Festival in aid of the victims of Tsunami in 2005. Important participants were Sundaram, Rangkarmee, Sayak, Lokokristi & host Pratikriti. Important seminar organized â€“ a) Meadia & Theatre in 2004, b) Manik Banerjee and Bengali theatre in 2006, c) From Literature to Theatre & Film in 2008. Publication â€“ Pratikriti has a publication wing and its 1st publication is on Sova Sen, a living legend in Bengali theatre, in 2004. Pratikriti â€“ Natyapatra, a theatre magazine is being published regularly since 2006.
